website_summaries.verdict: This anodized aluminum springform pan heats faster and cools quicker than other metals, giving you better results.
pros: Fits perfectly in 6- and 8-quart pressure cookers
Made of strong, safe anodized aluminum
cons: May leak slightly if you don't put a solid crust down first

customer_reviews.title: Not for cake other than cheesecake!
customer_reviews.text: I've got a home baking business and thought this pan would be perfect. It works great for cheesecake, but NOT with batter. As you can see, the batter runs out the bottom and seam. I was really hoping to replace my standard cake pans with these as the cakes bake flat and the pan cools fast. But sadly, that's not possible. 2 stars are for the perfect cheesecakes it turns out.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Exley

customer_reviews.title: It sprung a leak...
customer_reviews.text: Took me over a week to investigate 8” springform pans and settled on this one because I have had good experiences with this brand. Unfortunately the flaw appeared after I baked a cake in it, so returning it was out of the question. The seal where the ends meet is not a precise and the batter leaked onto the outside of the pan and after baked batter got in there, it was next to impossible to remove all the cake, even after soaking in hot water. While I probably can make a clean crusted cheesecake, I was under the impression any cake could be baked in this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Wish Upon A Dish

customer_reviews.title: Pan Leaks at Bottom Where Two Sides Connect
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used the Pan to make a cheesecake, after I put it in the oven, I noticed it was leaking out at the bottom where the two sides connect. I let it finish baking, when cake was cooled & I could open. I noticed that there is a small gap where it should close tightly. I returned the Pan for a refund. I will buy one that is positively recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne G

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Never ever thought about making cheese cake in my life.. but got an instant pot and had to get this nifty thing.. and bam cheese cake!!!! 40 min!!
customer_reviews.author: Janessa

customer_reviews.title: Step-up in quality
customer_reviews.text: Really nice spring form pan. Oversized if you like that kind of thing. Deep enough that you'll never be overflowing this guy. If you're baking in a water bath, you'll need an oversize pan (like for a deep dish pizza) to fit it. Works like every other springform pan ever. Mostly leakproof but only mostly. Use your heads people! I'd prefer a dishwasher safe pan with a non stick coating, but most of them are junk, and I won't pay $50 for my dream springform pan 'cause I have bigger dreams to chase for that price.
customer_reviews.author: e ahlgren

customer_reviews.title: NO LEAKAGE
customer_reviews.text: I had not cooked a cheese cake in years, because of problems with cheaper pans and the headaches they caused. This Cheese Cake Pan is very durable and designed so that it will not leak. Also my cheese cake slid right off onto another plate for easy cutting. The cake looked lovely on the bottom of the pan after releasing ring, but I would not recommend ever cutting on it. It is not flimsy like some cake pans and I expect I will never have to buy another one, unless it is for a gift or different size, since I only occasionally cook cheese cakes. Love It!
customer_reviews.author: GottoLOVEit

customer_reviews.title: Cute size but that’s all you get
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this is common for removable bottom pans, but it leaked after 2 uses. The spring lock was so sharp it cut my finger while unlocking it for washing. Worst buy of the year unfortunately. To the recycling bin it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best springform design!!
customer_reviews.text: I have baked cheesecakes for years and have an assortment of pans by various manufacturers. I needed some specific sizes for a wedding cake and ordered some Fat Daddios. Although I always cover the bottom of the pans with two layers of foil and then bake my cheesecakes in a water bath, often the water seeps into the pan making the bottom crust wet. These pans are the best design ever!! No way for the water to seep in. The cakes release easily and bake perfectly. I am replacing all of my cheesecake pans with this design by Fat Daddios!!
customer_reviews.author: V. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit IP like I needed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to make cheesecake in my Instant Pot, anticpating placing it on the rack with a cup of water. The rim around the bottom made it so the rack wouldn't fit in my IP - I had to place the pan directly in the Instant Pot and put the water in. It didn't work like I wanted :(
customer_reviews.author: W H

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, do not purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: After 25 years my old, cheap springform pan finally broke. I baked my first cake in this pan today and I’m extremely disappointed. The sides and bottom of cake came out too dark and the pan is very difficult to clean. I specifically purchased this light colored pan so as not to have dark cakes. . I was going to return it but cannot because I used it. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Margo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect springform pan for 6 qt instant pot
customer_reviews.text: I needed a springform pan that was deeper than the one I had for the 6qt instant pot. This one is perfect. It is 6x3. I had read about the label being near impossible to get off but perhaps the company changed the labels becasue it was a breeze to just peal off not a problem at all. This pan is nice and sturdy, it really is just what I needed. I am going to look at Big Daddio's bundt pans next.
customer_reviews.author: JayB

customer_reviews.title: For use with Instant Pot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use in my 6qt Instant Pot. It works great! My only complaint is that the lip is really wide. It isn't really a problem, I'd just prefer a little less lip and a little more cheesecake. ;)
customer_reviews.author: C. Anne Tipton

customer_reviews.title: OOOOooooooooppppppsssssssss!
customer_reviews.text: Sprang open on first cake and 1/3 of top part of cake came with it. I ASSUMED it would open properly, free of any cake being attached as I thoroughly sprayed the inside with PAM. I guess still getting the old table knife out still has to be an option to make sure to separate the cake from the pan. I will admit that this was my first ever cake to bake, cook, or whatever you consider your Mealthy Pot does to the cake.
customer_reviews.author: JayGee

customer_reviews.title: Just a Pan
customer_reviews.text: I returned this pan, so I cannot speak to it's actual functionality. I have a number of other Fat Daddio pans in my pantry that I am very pleased with, but their springform style fell short of expectations. It is a great design, and is made of decent material, but the clasp mechanism is horrid. It is very difficult to open and close it, and all of the exposed edges that are not rolled over are quite sharp. Such a shame, as I have grown fond of this maker's products. Just not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tattercat

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't rust like the others do, wife loves hers!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 for my wife to make cheesecake in her instant pot. She had ordered the Wilton best selling one and it rusted at the bottom in the groove where the bottom goes in. Got her this one because the cheesecake was FABULOUS and we didn't want something that would rust again and aluminum won't. Every time she uses it she is telling me how much she loves it so definitely recommended over the Wilton ones!!! It's also stackable and easier to grab hold of, she tells me.
customer_reviews.author: Idonotlikespiders

customer_reviews.title: Best Cheesecake Pan!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pan for use with cheesecakes only. After the first use I am glad with this pick, my cheesecake came out perfect. I used a water bath and had no issues with the water getting into any aspect of my cake. The base that the cheesecake sits on is alot higher than the bottom lip. I had no issues removing my cake from the base.
customer_reviews.author: Tonyah242

customer_reviews.title: Works with instant pot Duo
customer_reviews.text: Nice springform. I was looking for a cheesecake pan that would fit in my instant pot duo. This did the job. The base fit into the instant pot when the rack is inserted first. I didn’t have a problem with leaking.
customer_reviews.author: HomemadeWithLove

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time use this pan to make a tiramisu cake for my mother in law’s 90th birthday. When I open the pan this morning. The edge of the opening part is very sharp likes a knife. It cuts my two fingers and cause my finger bleeding badly.

customer_reviews.title: Creamy cheesecake
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my old 9" spring form pan since 1980 and I have cooked a zillion cakes with the old standby but I was due for an upgrade so for Christmas I bought myself the Fat Daddio's 9' pan. I used their recipe for kicks and grins and I was pleasantly surprised by the finished product. The quality of the the new pan is good and I plan on keeping this one for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It leaked, but the cake cooked thoroughly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan specifically for the New York Times gingerbread cake with lemon glaze recipe, which required a 8" springform. I am fairly picky regarding bakeware, and rely heavily on Wirecutter and Cook's Illustrated recommendations. However, 8 inches is an atypical size, and was simply happy to find one. Disappointed to find that this pan did leak. Thankfully the batter was quite dense, so it wasn't as catastrophic as it might have been.
customer_reviews.author: PNW Spruce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and value! Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant pan! I highly recommend choosing bottom with parchment for easy removal of crusted desert to plate. Table knives will scratch surface. This pan DID NOT leak at all. Used for cheesecake. Washed in dishwasher. Excellent quality and value! I will definitely be buying more in this product line.
customer_reviews.author: gr8tchr4u

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Great pans. Heats fast and cools fast. Great design for catching any drip or run off. You don't need to put it in a bath. As long as you put a small pan of water in the oven while baking you will get a great smooth, moist product. I like to use the center rack, as most people do, so I just put a small pan of water on the bottom rack underneath the cake. Perfect. It's well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Beyond awesome. Leaks are user-error. Note the arrow. Avoid dishwasher.
customer_reviews.text: These are beyond awesome. Anyone complaining about leaks didn't read the instructions (note the arrow). The only negative thing I can point out is the sharp edges of the ring near the clasp.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha R.

customer_reviews.title: Instant pot / cheese cake pan - awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love this pan! I make cheesecakes in the instant pot and this pan is awesome! Does not stick, easy to clean and heavy duty. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: JOYCE S

customer_reviews.title: Works great for cheesecake
customer_reviews.text: I used this pan in the Instantpot to make a cheese cake. Perfect size for the pot. And oh my Lord, the cheesecake was scrumptious! I kept sneaking back for more. I suggest you make everyone their own little cheesecake, so there’s no fighting. So maybe buy at least 2 pans so you can keep it moving.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This 8" springform pan worked very well. I am taking one star away because where the seam of the pan comes together is somewhat hard to clean. Be sure to really inspect the inside seam so you get all the debris out of the small opening. I washed by hand; a dishwasher would probably clean that spot, but I'm not sure it is dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this pan thinking it will work in your 8 qt Instant Pot!
customer_reviews.text: I have a smaller spring form pan for my 6 qt Instant Pot but wanted a bigger one for my 8 qt IP for lasagna, etc. I read about this 8x3' pan in my Rootitoot Cookbook, how much they liked the Fat Daddy pan for the 8 qt. Very high praises BUT they must be referring to this brand's 8x3" PUSH bottom pan/not the spring form pan. now, upon reading the questions/answers I see that this DOES NOT fit my 8 qt IP. so I am returning it/very disappointed/I will order another brand's 8x3" spring form which states it does fit my 8 qt.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Professional-quality springform
customer_reviews.text: Great, professional quality springform pan. Produces wonderful cheesecakes and helps prevent leaks. Also, easy to release cake for serving, decorating, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Now I just need some bigger ones! I don’t think I realized how small this was. Also I was kind of worried it would leak because of reviews saying it did. Mine didn’t. Not once. I wrapped the bottom with foil and baked it on a baking sheet just in case and it never did leak! Very easy to clean! Very easy to operate. I would hand wash this only though!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Ann Thompson

customer_reviews.title: MY ONE & ONLY SPRINGFORM PAN
customer_reviews.text: Fat Daddio is my go-to for professional baking pans. This one is no exception. Quality made with a secure clasp....very tight. It will not leak!! Other manufacturers do not compare to Fat Daddio. I threw away all of my other springform pans after receiving this one.
customer_reviews.author: mac1660_0

customer_reviews.title: Fits in my Instapot perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Best pan for making cheesecake in my instapot! It fits nicely and is super easy to clean...LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Bought it to use in my 3 quart Instant Pot ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to use in my 3 quart Instant Pot. The ring part fits but the bottom is too big. So if you buy it for this purpose make sure of the inches. I'll use it not in the pot, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spring rusted out after two uses!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6 qt IP, works great for cheesecake. HOWEVER - I have used this twice, washed & dried on the counter top but the spring screw has rusted completely making it difficult to close .. I assume this will break and I won’t be able to use it and it’s too late to return it & I regret buying this . If you’re looking for a small springform pan don’t buy this one .
customer_reviews.author: Griff

customer_reviews.title: it leaks
customer_reviews.text: Not good for cheesecake. I had such a huge puddle on the counter after filling the pan, I had to dump the batter back into the bowl, and prep my old pan that only has a slow leak. I would give this pan a zero if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Annieo

customer_reviews.title: It leaked!
customer_reviews.text: Before ordering this pan I read the reviews. It is a heavy pan and cleaned easily but it also leaked. I ran graham cracker crust up the sides slightly being conscious of others stated problems with leaking but to no avail. Leakage wasn't great but still annoying. My old pan was more dependable but sadly was getting rusty. For twice the price the company should be able to do better.
customer_reviews.author: anita

customer_reviews.title: Excellent brand
customer_reviews.text: I’m a fan of all Fat Daddio products. This is a great 8” springform pan and when greased/coated properly it provides a very clean and professional look. It provides reliable consistency.
customer_reviews.author: ND

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty restaurant quality..
customer_reviews.text: Would give 6 stars if I could...restaurant / industrial quality...I bought 3..Only bad thing is it is made in China... Please make in USA!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Talmage

customer_reviews.title: don't buy  this pan
customer_reviews.text: After using this pan twice the latch malfunctioned and we could get the pan to close. I am disappointed in this pan and won't purchase another product from this company. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: valerie moustakas

customer_reviews.title: This Springform pand is as described.
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended by the folk at 365 days of Instant pot recipes. I love it. Food slides right off and it has solved my problem of food burning on the bottom of my instant pot.
customer_reviews.author: rothl

customer_reviews.title: Working on it
customer_reviews.text: I’m still trying to get my cheese cake like in my old pan. I’ve made three so far. The first one cracked. The second one too weepy and the third didn’t come out looking like my old one. However I’m not giving up. I will perfect this cheesecake in this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Patsy Ann

customer_reviews.title: Not for use on breakfast casserole
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to make a recipe in the instant pot to make an egg-based casserole but the eggs are too viscous and leak out. I reordered to see if it was just the first pan, but the second pan had the same results. Did not try with anything else. The spring form pan I purchased in an amazon set has a better seal. It may work just fine for more dense items like cheesecake and lasagnas.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Not for what I bake
customer_reviews.text: Had mine almost two years. For what I needed them for, a chocolate torte recipe, I found the bottom outer edge tended to come out burned or close to it. Might be okay for other, maybe lighter types of cakes I guess. It does leak, but the lip holds enough so that I didn't have to clean my oven afterwards--but that seems to be where the problem was, because it seemed like those edges fried endlessly in the leaking butter. Replaced mine with Kuhn Rikon pans, which I like a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: laceknitter

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: OMG.. I absolutely, without a doubt love this pan.I hated having to crack my crust each time I would take out a cheesecake from other types of springform pan. With this time, you open it up, and pretty much Slice of Cheesecake right off the pan. I only bought two because that's all I was able to afford, but I wish I had 10 more of these.
customer_reviews.author: betty_v

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pan and a perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wanting this Spring Form Pan for a while. It goes perfect in my 6 qt InstantPot and also my 8 qt Paula Deen Airfryer.
customer_reviews.author: MaryCherry

customer_reviews.title: Great food comes from this!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice pan. I use for my 8qt InstantPot. It fits onto the trivet that came with the pot. I did have some leaking however. No pan is perfect, I chose this one because it has the lip at the bottom that catches leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Natures Retreat

customer_reviews.title: Annoying Sticker! GAH!@&*%#$
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, solid construction. Looks like it will last a long time. My only problem is that the sticker on the inside on the pan was attached using some sort of gluey resin that is impossible to remove. Literally, my only option was to use a razor blade to scrape it off, and then sand it down to bare metal. This obviously, left visible scratches on the pan. Why does the manufacturer use this type of substance on the INSIDE on the pan? WHY?!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Hynes

customer_reviews.title: Consistent cooking.
customer_reviews.text: Smell funky at first couple of washes I find, but works good and I never tasted the smell in the finished food product.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Leakproof
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I received this pan I couldn’t wait to bake my favorite red velvet cake. I read so many reviews about it leaking that I did the water test as soon as I received it, even though the water leaked it held the cake batter really well (batter being thicker). Not only that, I loved the ease of use and the fact that the cake was baked evenly made it a delight to use this pan. I highly recommend buying this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality, heavy aluminum
customer_reviews.text: CHEESE CAKE HEAVEN ! Fits perfectly in the 6 quart INSTANTPOT ! Very nice quality, heavy aluminum. Nicely constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott V.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent baking tool.
customer_reviews.text: Other than the large bottom :) (storage issue) this is a great pan, superior to the cheap crap one I replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Gallstones

customer_reviews.title: Love to make pressure cooker cheese cake!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fits great in my 6 qt. Instant Pot! Easy to put together and to take apart to clean. No leaks either!
customer_reviews.author: spidersmate

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pan to cook my cheese cake in with my convection oven and this one is great with no warping .Easy to handle and it releases nicely. It is the only pan I will use from now on.
customer_reviews.author: RUSTY HOGLAND

customer_reviews.title: Pressure Luck on YouTube suggested these and they're great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used for an Instapot egg dish Pressure Luck onYouTube made, really great snapping action, not so easy to clean if you go light on the spray so go heavy and enjoy cooking with these great pieces!
customer_reviews.author: Bahahahah

customer_reviews.title: Nice pan,leaked
customer_reviews.text: I like the size. Construction seems sturdy but it did leak a bit. Otherwise I would have given 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Alart!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when i received the cake pan, i bought it to bake a cake for my son birthday BUT all the cake start leaking from the pan... very disappointed!! and this pan is not eligible for return. save your money and buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Shani S.

customer_reviews.title: I especially liked that it is elevated
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge! It actually backfired on me, as it was so big that the cheesecake I made in it wasn't high enough for what I expected. Be warned; you'll either have to increase your recipes or you'll have smaller results. Still delicious, and cleans and works perfectly. I especially liked that it is elevated, so once I removed the springform, it was already on a platter. It is big, thought.
customer_reviews.author: David Koonce

customer_reviews.title: Good design, well made of a high grade aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Good design, well made of a high grade aluminum. I made a cake in this pan and it came out well. Be sure to use a vegetable spray in the pan before baking your cake or torte.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn L. Abramsky

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to clean due to food sticking but other than that great product!! Have to use more elbow grease !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: What A Great Springform Pan!
customer_reviews.text: These pans are wonderful. They're a nice, heavy weight and deep enough to keep your batter from mushrooming over the top. And they have a nice wide edge around the bottom to prevent anything leaking from spilling into the oven. They also have the best non-stick coating. There's very little on the ring when you remove it and the cakes slide right off the bottom. Not only do the cakes come out easily and look better when they do, the pans are so easy to clean! This is the best springform pan I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Joa429

customer_reviews.title: Great little pan!
customer_reviews.text: I use this springform pan to make lasagna in my Instant Pot. Fits in the pot great and works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Deana

customer_reviews.title: Best spring form pan ever
customer_reviews.text: I have been making cheesecakes for 27 years...my only regret is that I didn’t have this pan 27 years ago!!! I will replace every spring form pan I have with this pan! How did I go this long without this pan, I will never know....
customer_reviews.author: d Padezanin-Sklack

customer_reviews.title: Prefessional quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent professional quality. Avoid Teflon finishes which can flake with use. These are the best! Has a well designed rim to catch drips. One regular sized cheesecake will fit in two of these pans.
customer_reviews.author: TexasShopper

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Pan
customer_reviews.text: This is definately the Daddio of cheesecake springform pans! I received it and couldn’t believe how beautiful it was. I love that it comes with a nice large base. I still have not used it to make my massive restaurant size cheesecake but I’m excited to use it!
customer_reviews.author: connie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is the best springform cake pan I ever owned. Fat daddios is the best. Makes perfect shaped cakes
customer_reviews.author: Maria C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for waterbaths
customer_reviews.text: I make a lot of cheesecakes and do a traditional water bath. My old springform would leak and I'd end up with a soggy crust ugh! This has no leaks! No ruined cheesecakes since using this pan!
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Small, sturdy cheesecake pans ideal for a baking business
customer_reviews.text: These pans are well-constructed; they seem functional yet attractive. I love them and plan to buy more in larger sizes to replace the large sizes I currently use. I haven't used them to bake my cheesecakes yet, but I intend to update my review at a later date. Hand wash the pans –– do not use the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Classy

customer_reviews.title: Best Springform Pan I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: Love these pans! Easy to clean, easy to use and baked beautiful cheesecakes. I really like the wide bottom that makes it easier to grip and for more stability. I plan on purchasing many more pans from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Janette York

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pan.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for personal cheesecake. I need to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: david meltzer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed by the workmanship
customer_reviews.text: Good material. Great concept but the workmanship was awful. There is a large gap at the connection. I did not have to use it to know it is going to leak big time. I know I will lose a big portion of my cake through the gap even with thick batter. I don’t expect springform pan not to be leak proof but I am very disappointed with this high end product. I am giving it two stars because of the good material.
customer_reviews.author: Baker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pan!
customer_reviews.text: This pan is fantastic! It is heavy gage aluminum and cooks my cheesecake perfectly! I bought several more of these pans to give to my family. They are equally impressed with the quality and how well they perform. I highly recommend this pan!
customer_reviews.author: Colts Fan

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought another brand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I thought it was a high-end product given the price. It leaked the first time AND it did not cook the cake properly. The cheap pan I borrowed from a friend carmelized the edges. I would not recommend this product and wish I could send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Arbor

customer_reviews.title: Best cake pan I ever own
customer_reviews.text: There is a gap near the joint that cause cake mix to leak, best to seal the gap with moist flour before pour in cake mix.
customer_reviews.author: KAREN KWOK

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This pan is awesome. It baked my cheesecake very well, very even. I don’t use a water bath when I bake cheesecakes so I cannot speak to how it performs in that scenario. The cake released very well, I just put a parchment circle down on the bottom and didn’t spray or butter my pan and nothing stuck.
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality with visible gap and hole at connecting edges. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: ZNNVA

customer_reviews.title: Worked fabulously and we enjoyed the perfect size cheesecake for our family and guests
customer_reviews.text: Used it in my instant pot. Worked fabulously and we enjoyed the perfect size cheesecake for our family and guests.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: really nice pan, really good quality i love it. Easy to clean, easy to remove, very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: faustin hoover

customer_reviews.title: This pan is good!
customer_reviews.text: This pan works much better than the last one I purchased from the same seller.
customer_reviews.author: Tedster10

customer_reviews.title: This is a good quality pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality pan. I give it 4 stars because I still cannot get cheesecake waterbath to work for me. I thought this pan might be the solution. But despite the foil wrap, water still got in somehow and made the crust soggy. I guess that's not the fault of the pan. I'm done trying cheesecake waterbath. But this pan functions fine.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pan after viewing a video for several recipes for my instant pot. Made my first cheesecake this week! Worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: NR

customer_reviews.title: Great quality...
customer_reviews.text: Will stand up to anything a homeowner can throw at it!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Osdyke Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: This pan makes the perfect cheesecake. No leaks and easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Sue M

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: Great pan. No leaks. Used in my instant pot for cheesecake and it was perfect for the task. Cleaned quite easily. This is a hand wash product so no dishwasher!
customer_reviews.author: Patsy W

customer_reviews.title: Purchase for cheese cake mastery
customer_reviews.text: Does A nice job of cooking cheesecake but I have not used it for much more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua La Pointe

customer_reviews.title: Great springform pan for instant pot
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent, it works great for cheesecakes and even lasagnas. Fits perfectly in my 7 qt instant pot. Well made and substantial.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy - works well, No leaks
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made, and works well. Bought for my 6qt instant pot - should have bought the 7" pan though
customer_reviews.author: Tom G.

customer_reviews.title: So excited to use in my oven and instant but was a disaster!
customer_reviews.text: I used this a couple times and every time it leaked thru the bottom. I had such a mess each time. The last time I was so frustrated with the mess that it made that I threw it all in the dishwasher. What a mistake!! I would love to return but missed the cut off date. ugh
customer_reviews.author: barbara

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: Love it, I bought it for my mom and it's 10 times better than mine!
customer_reviews.author: Chay M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great in 6 qt. Instant pot.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this pan. It’s for use in my instant pot. It fits perfectly and stands up to the pressure cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Easy to close and open. Makes perfect Cheesecakes every time.
customer_reviews.text: I love my springform pans!!! Easy to close and open without any problem. My Cheesecakes comes out perfect every time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: I love this pan!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan! It's the best cheesecake pan I've ever owned. Speeds up the baking process because the aluminum distributes the heat better and is easy to clean up. Very heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Jedd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and functional. I needed one for sweet items. The two for savory foods are reserved.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to your InstaPot
customer_reviews.text: We already had one of these and this was a gift that we had sent to a relative. Nice addition to your InstaPot.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Anselmo

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this pan. I wasn't so sure that my cheesecake wouldn't stick to the sides, but it came out perfectly. I had a little trouble opening it when it was empty, the ring didn't seem to want to expand enough to come off, but once I used it and removed it from my cheesecake, it came off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied customer!

customer_reviews.title: Fat Daddio's Aluminum Anodized 6 Inch x 3 Inch Round Springform Cake Pan
customer_reviews.text: Good quality little cake pan that is perfect to serve between 2-4 people. You can make cheese cakes for half the price of what you can buy them for. Now that my husband and I are home most of the time without the children, this cake pan is perfect for us and/or when we have another couple over for dinner.
customer_reviews.author: JulianeTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Fat Daddios Springform Pan
customer_reviews.text: Fat Daddios springform pans are without a doubt the BEST. I ordered my first one , loved it so much that I have since ordered two more different sizes. The cheesecakes just slide off and do not stick. It's a beautiful thing!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Carlin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth time and effort plus expense of pan.
customer_reviews.text: We did a savory pasta dish that called for this size pan. Knew I was in trouble when cooking spray leaked out. Continued with recipe and when baking sauce leaked out making pasta dry. Cervices hard to clean even after soaking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pan
customer_reviews.text: Love it; a very solid springform cake pan. I like how much taller It is compared to other ones.
customer_reviews.author: fromca

customer_reviews.title: Love these pans
customer_reviews.text: I love the 3" depth. I like to bake huge cakes and cut them into layers. I use this springform pan for baking regular cakes. With parchment paper on the bottom and buttered sides it makes cakes a snap to remove from the pan. The rim on the bottom, while probably not absolutely needed, makes the pan easy to handle and move around.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Best pan ever
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great pan! The lip is great for the drips from the crust. The cheesecake comes out unbelievably high. It's easy to remove both the sides and the bottom. It washes great. Everything browns nicely and cooks evenly too. I use these pans for my restaurant. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: maura

customer_reviews.title: Not dishwasher safe
customer_reviews.text: Though the item description says "handwash recommended," it should instead say "handwash only." I washed it in the dishwasher and it is now very damaged and appears to have burned/has a big dark spot with residue.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

product_meta.title: Fat Daddio's Springform Pan Anodized Aluminum, 6 x 3 Inch, Silver
feature_bullets: FITS PERFECTLY - Fits 6 & 8-quart pressure cookers and 4 & 5.3-quart air fryers
EASY CAKE RELEASE - Stainless steel latch and removable wide-base bottom, makes cake-release simple and easy… just push.

ANODIZED ALUMINUM - It’s the ideal baking surface. Our ‘Safe-Seal’ anodizing process creates a safer, stronger baking pan. A durable, non-reactive finish that bakes a wider variety of recipes, including citrus-based and savory recipes. Freezer safe.

NO EXTRA METALS OR CHEMICAL COATINGS - Anodizing is not a coating. It is an environmentally-friendly process that contains no chemical additives, dyes, PTFE’s or PFOA’s. Nothing that can transfer, peel, flake or rust into your baking.

HEATS & COOLS QUICKER - By reflecting heat, rather than absorbing heat, ProSeries cake pans reach baking temperatures faster. Even heating allows for the best possible rise. Once out of the oven, they cool quicker preventing over-baking.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars780 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
